napplet
Interface Nit

All Known Implementing Classes:
Animator, Box, FireCube, MouseBlock, NApplet, NAppletChainingTest.BigNApplet, NAppletChainingTest.BigNApplet.LittleNApplet, NAppletTest, Nibblet, NitBase, SwingBlock, Throbber
public interface Nit

Interface for objects managed by NAppletManager. Applies to NApplets obviously, but can also be used for lighter objects, even those without their own display space (e.g., a "NApplet lite" type object that draws in its parent's space.)

Author:
acsmith

Method Summary

          Draw the Nit.

Returns the x coordinate of the Nit's upper left corner in its parent's display space.

Return the y coordinate of the Nit's upper left corner in its parent's display space.

Returns:

setPosition

void setPosition(int x,
                 int y)
Set the Nit's position in its parent's display space.

Parameters:
x - horizontal position of the Nit's upper left corner.
y - vertical position of the Nit's upper left corner.

getWidth

int getWidth()
Return the Nit's width in pixels.

Returns:
width of the Nit in pixels

getHeight

int getHeight()
Return the Nit's height in pixels.

Returns:
height of the Nit in pixels

isEmbedded

boolean isEmbedded()
Tells whether the Nit is embedded in another Nit's display window, or has its own window.

Returns:
true for an embedded Nit, false for a Nit in its own window (including a NApplet running in standalone mode, i.e., as a PApplet.)

getFrame

Frame getFrame()

Get the NAppletManager object responsible for handling this Nit.

void setNAppletManager(NAppletManager nappletManager)
Set the NAppletManager responsible for this Nit.

Parameters:

setup

void setup()
Set up Nit-specific variables, etc. Similar to PApplet.setup().

draw

void draw()
Draw the Nit. Similar to PApplet.draw();

inputHit

boolean inputHit(int x,
                 int y)
Filter to determine whether to pass an input event (generally mouse or keyboard) to the Nit.

Parameters:
x - Mouse x position (in the Nit's coordinates.)
y - Mouse y position (in the Nit's coordinates.)
Returns:
true if the Nit wants to claim the event; otherwise gets passed through to any other Nit(s) that might be eligible.

passEvent

void passEvent(InputEvent event)
Pass any java.awt.event.InputEvent objects to the Nit. (Generally mouse or keyboard.)

Parameters:
event -

focusGained

void focusGained(FocusEvent gainFocus)
Inform the Nit that it's gained focus.

Parameters:
gainFocus -

focusLost

void focusLost(FocusEvent loseFocus)
Inform the Nit that it's lost focus.

Parameters:
loseFocus -

runFrame

void runFrame()
Run and draw a single graphics frame. Usually calls the Nit's draw() method and in some cases may do other things as well.
